intro: Diplostephium schultzii var. lehmanniana, commonly known as the Lehmann's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, which are typical of the spurge family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
